definition: to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
point of a spear/edge of a tool/vanguard/forward (in sports team)

sentences.english: This was the first historical draw of the Veneti in Turin.
sentences.chinese: 这是双方在都灵交锋上的第一次平局。

sentences.english: This is mostly because there is little head-to-head competition between America and China.
sentences.chinese: 这主要是由于中美之间几乎没有贸易上的正面交锋。

sentences.english: Carlos Tevez has scored four goals in six Premier League appearances against Liverpool.
sentences.chinese: 特维斯在近六次与利物浦的交锋中打入四球。

sentences.english: The last two matches between these teams at the DW Stadium have finished goalless.
sentences.chinese: 这两支球队过去两次在DW球场交锋都没有入球产生。

sentences.english: I’ve fought all of these enemies at one time or another.
sentences.chinese: 我跟所有这些敌人都交锋过不止一次。

sentences.english: Similarly he tries not to cross the Russians, who are also prone to throwing tantrums.
sentences.chinese: 同样，潘也避免与易怒的俄罗斯交锋。

sentences.english: Faced with the danish advance, alfred did not risk open battle .
sentences.chinese: 对付丹麦军的进攻，艾尔弗雷德尽力避开正面交锋。

sentences.english: Lazio play against Sampdoria this weekend in the second round of Serie A games.
sentences.chinese: 拉齐奥将在本周末的意甲第二轮与桑普多利亚交锋。

sentences.english: He was taken captive by the P. L. A. men at the first engagement.
sentences.chinese: 他在第一次交锋时被人民解放军战士俘虏。

sentences.english: There have been several clashes with Juve, in recent times as well.
sentences.chinese: 他们与尤文之间曾有多场经典战役，近年来也有交锋。

sentences.english: We're getting close to the end, and the match at Cesena will be an important one.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经接近目标了，和切塞纳的交锋将会非常重要。

sentences.english: Let him begin to circle and let the fight come.
sentences.chinese: 让这鱼打起转来，就来交锋吧。

sentences.english: Peoples of the world could meet one another at a cricket or a football match .
sentences.chinese: 世界各国的民众能在足球赛或板球赛上交锋。

sentences.english: France and Spain will meet in the soccer cup final.
sentences.chinese: 法国队和西班牙队将在足球锦标赛决赛中交锋。

sentences.english: Doesn t this sound like a worthy goal?
sentences.chinese: 交锋这就像一个有价值的目标声音？

sentences.english: And I'm not talking about some regular-season snoozer against Golden State.
sentences.chinese: 不要跟我提常规赛与金州勇士的交锋。

definition: to face off against one's adversary (military, sports etc)
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
to meet/to run into (sb)/to get together (with sb)
on the up/currently winning/rising (in popularity etc)
to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of
total victory/to excel by far/name of a tank/slam
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
to be utterly defeated/to be routed
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
